Fret not; here is a list of colors that you must elude as a wedding guest to make a signature appearance.      

Say No to:

White

White has always been popular for inducing peace and tranquility and we’re pretty sure most of you think you look simply stunning when wearing white. Yes, white is surely one of the most significant wedding colors but who wants to stick to simple white when wedding season calls for the guests to spread glamour by wearing dresses of vivacious colors like lustrous shades of pink. As the bride is the center of attraction for the day so let her standout in all white unless you’re asked to dress in white by the couple. An alluring alternative for white is a slip dress styled using our pink satin fabric that will surely land you in heaps of compliments. Nothing can substitute white better than a dreamy pink for a subtle wedding color scheme. Besides pink, some similar hues in pink family that will surely make you look and feel pretty are peach, blush, rose gold, rose quartz, dusty rose and mauve.

Black 

Selecting the right outfit for an upcoming wedding can be somewhat challenging as you need to be cautious about the appropriate color choice that would seamlessly connect with the season and the occasion. Although black is a very powerful color with a lot of versatility but it is often considered as a hue associated with mourning and grief and therefore might be taken as faux pas for the happiest events like a wedding. This wedding season, try out a diversified color scheme with wide range of shades by choosing our dusty rose satin silk fabric. Add a touch of your own creativity and make your dream dress. Whether you want to go for a modern gown or flirty fit- and- flare styles, this elegant fabric gives you everything to make you look perfect for the occasion. Make sure you complete your look with essential accessories that will gorgeously glam up and compliment your outfit for the special occasion.

Neon:

If your upcoming wedding highlights a spring inspired décor make sure you dress up accordingly and let the blossoms bloom alone. Balance the vibrant floral arrangements and tie in the wedding color scheme by keeping neon and overly bright hues aside when choosing your dress. For the upcoming nuptial dress up in cool pastel shades by opting for outfits flawlessly stitched out of lavender or royal blue satin fabric.

 

Pro tip: Before you finalize your wedding outfit with a perfect color, try to look for a dress code in the wedding invite, know the couple’s taste and consider the weather.  

 

While planning to choose your wedding dress color as a guest, try picking shades that help you blend with everyone while not stealing the spotlight from the bride as this is bride’s day and she deserves to be the epicenter of attraction for the entire program. Share your innovative inspirations of unique color dress you have chosen to wear in the upcoming wedding you are invited to.

entry.title: What Is A Miss To Mrs Box?
entry.content:
Did your BFF just get engaged? Are you searching for a unique present for her engagement, shower, or wedding? How about a miss to mrs bridal box? We think it can’t get any better than that! But if you haven’t heard of it before and wondering what is a miss to mrs box, it is a bridal subscription box full of goodies and wedding essentials to pamper the bride-to-be and alleviate some pre-wedding stress that comes with planning.

You can go for the bride gift box subscription service to deliver multiple miss to mrs themed boxes at her doorstep every month till the wedding day to shower your bestie with your love over and over again! Do you love the idea of a bride box but want to make it extra special and unique? Why not create your own gift boxes! Keep on reading and find out how to create a personalized bride gift box and what to include in it to celebrate the bride-to-be’s transition from miss to mrs!

Choose A Unique Box Style!

When creating a DIY bride box, kick things off by picking a unique box style that is big enough to hold all your items. We recommend using our sturdy crystal clear acrylic boxes with lids that’ll help you stylishly display all the goodies you plan to include in your themed bridal boxes. In case you’re looking for cheaper box options, opt for our chic transparent decoration boxes with white edges instead to stay within your budget!

Pick Your Gift Items!

Once you have your boxes all sorted, move on to picking your gifts. Take inspiration from the miss to mrs box themes and select your items accordingly. Here are some ideas on what items you can include in each box.

Set the wedding planning in motion with your first gift box and include a wedding planning checklist, notebook and wedding day countdown calendar along with a heart shaped frame featuring the newly engaged couple photograph, giant diamond ring balloon, balloon and tassel decoration kit for any upcoming celebrations, and diamond candy containers filled with assorted sweet treats to let the bride-to-be indulge in the sweetness of love!

Whereas, for the next bridal box, turn on the party mood with photo booth props, cake toppers, pom poms, tassels, string lights, party garlands, miss to mrs banner, confetti, heart wine bottle stoppers, and other fun party supplies and decorations.

Since wedding planning can take its toll, pamper the bride to be with a box filled with beauty care products, spa coupons, scented rose petal soap, cute heart candles, and a lovely heart shaped tea infuser spoon to let her relax after a stressful day of pre-wedding chores.

However, for the last bride box that’ll be delivered just before the wedding day, opt for items such as a giant “I Do” balloon, cake knife and server set, wedding champagne flutes with Koozies, wedding stationery and pen set. Also, fill up some airplane suitcase favor boxes with small trinkets to signify the journey from miss to mrs and pen down a heartfelt letter to shower the bride with your love!

Deck Out The Box In Style!

Because first impressions are crucial, stylishly decorate your DIY bridal gift boxes before you send them out. Either opt for decorative grass box fillers or stuff colorful streamers, loose silk flower petals, or feathers & boas inside each box to keep your items in place. Whereas to make the bride box look even prettier, wrap it in tulle fabric tying the ends with ribbons or bedeck the lid with a gorgeous bunch of assorted bloom heads or bedazzle the box with rhinestones and decorative letter stickers for added glitz and glam, the choice is all yours! 

Though your love and friendship are no doubt the best gifts you can give to your newly engaged bestie, a lovely bride gift box with personalized touches is surely a close second! Whether you plan to send out only one gift box or multiple boxes, make sure to add a nice mix of wedding planning essentials and fun

decor items to jazz it up! What items are you going to include in your bride box? Share your ideas with us in the comments section below!

Choose the Right Pot

Choosing the right kind of pots for your pink moonstone succulent plants is the first nurturing method. Moonstone succulent plants do not belong to the type that grows too much of lengthy roots and speaking of which, the 11” Rose Gold Polypropylene with Metallic Hammered Design or the 12” Rose Gold Polypropylene Indoor Plant Pot can be the perfect variant for housing your plants. Well, this might make you wonder why choosing a pot is so important while talking about, how do you get pink succulents? Well, the pot plays a significant role in making your succulent pink moonstone become bright and charming. Small pots mean less water intake and when the pink moonstone succulent is given less water than the normal limit, it compels the moonstone plant to store majority of the water received into its leaves which is very necessary for its pink shade. If you choose to grow a series of different shaded moonstone succulent plants together, then you might find the Rectangle Preserved Moss Planter Box with Inner Lining to be a perfect fit for your plan.

Placing Rocks – for Proper Water Flow

The next nurturing method for a bright pink moonstone succulent is to regulate proper water flow to the moonstone plant and within the soil. Too much of water within the soil will cause your moonstone succulent to suffer root rotting and this is where, the decorative rocks come in very handy. Place the Assorted Natural Polished Decorative Stones within the soil just beneath the roots. The polished surface of these rocks will make the water drain out easily which in turn makes the moonstone plant enjoy a healthy root system. On the other hand, the Metallic Rose Gold Crushed Gravel can be spread or scattered across the top soil of the pink moonstone succulent as it will stop the soil from drying fast when exposed to sunlight.

Ample Amount of Sunlight is the Trick

The third and the most important nurturing method for a lush pink moonstone succulent is to expose the moonstone plant to sunlight in abundance up to 90°F as it makes the plant to emit bright pink shades in the absence of sunrays. But this can be quite a challenge inside apartments as not all places of your house will get proper sunlight coming in except the balcony to accommodate all your succulent pink moonstone plants. But, there is no need to fret. Use the 3 Tiered Wooden Planter Stand with Metal Ladder or the 4 Tiered Wooden Planter Stand with Metal Ladder based on the number of moonstone succulent plants you have. The tiered nature of this wooden planter can house all pink moonstone succulent plants and other moonstone plants as well, one below another which will enable all of them to acquire ample amount of sunlight leading to their healthy growth.

These three nurturing steps what we discussed above are very much enough for growing healthy pink moonstone succulent plants but following them consistently is the key to it. Season & Wedding Colors!

Seasons play an important role in picking up some beautiful wedding colors as every season has its own beautiful shade and tinges. For instance, a wedding planned in spring season must have all the pretty spring wedding colors, like light pastels and pairing them with deeper shades like coral or fushia will let you create that perfect romantic look that you are looking for. If you’re saying ‘I do’ in summers, the good wedding colors for summers can be in brighter tones, like bold reds, yellow, blue, or purples. These summer wedding colors will bring energy and spark into your ambiance and will give your guests a refreshing and lively feel. Fall wedding colors are simply magical, the earthy tones like moss green, gold, natural, and burgundy works perfect for a fall wedding. Winter has its own charisma, the sparkling snow when gets paired with deep and dark tones of winter wedding colors like burgundy, red, blue or the metallic hues like copper, gold, bronze, gray, or silver, the outcome you get is simply mind-blowing!

Help You Create Cool Color Palettes!

Colors have their own language; you can feel the essence of any space by simply looking around the colors it is adorned with. While choosing wedding colors for your special day make sure that you choose colors that complement each other. You can create cool wedding colors palette by pairing two or three best wedding colors, but make sure that your pairing is in contrast. The simplest way to think about color pairings is by selecting bright colors with neutral ones. For instance, if you have chosen orange or red as your wedding colors, blend them with natural, teal or peach, combining dusty rose and copper with colors like gray and plum you get some stunning wedding colors for your wedding. Even pairing burgundy, purple, coral, or fushia with gold or any other metallic hue will give your event some pretty wedding colors. An elegant white backdrop with apple green is also one of those best wedding colors that you can opt for, complement these wedding colors with the rest of the decorations and leave an ever-lasting impact on your guests.

Wedding Colors In Floral Décor!

Flowers are a must have part of any wedding and while creating wedding flower arrangements make sure that your choice of colors matches with the wedding colors that you have in your wedding décor. From wedding arches, backdrops, centerpieces to bridal bouquets the wedding colors that you pick to make the arrangement speaks a lot about your event. Using the wedding colors of the bridal bouquet as the leading color in your wedding décor can be a great idea. For a spring garden wedding, your flower arrangement should be in pastel wedding colors, like blush, rose gold, peach, pink, white or lavender. If you have a boho chic wedding, set your floral décor in yellow, bright red, sage green & blush with green wedding colors and give an eye-catching and inviting feel to your space. For your winter wedding, choosing elegant wedding colors like white, cream, or ivory for flowers with a sprinkle of blue, pale blush, burgundy, or red will be a great choice.

The Building Blocks

Triangular structures are simple but classy additions to the event design as they add a touch of character and whimsy to the settings. Building a wedding triangle arch from scratch is much easier than you probably think. All you need are a couple of wooden planks and the right hardware and tools to assemble them. Start by measuring the planks and cut them according to how tall you want your arch to be. Either arrange the two planks in a crisscrossed pattern or cut the planks to create a vertex joining them with screws to make a basic triangular structure. Next, sandwich each post leg of your triangle arch between two small wooden boards and drive long screws or bolts through them creating a stable base for your wooden triangle wedding arch. First things first, you’ll need a way to inform your guests what their table numbers are, so arranging a table with escort cards at the entrance is an easy way to direct your guests to their assigned tables. You can either use personalized wedding favor boxes with place cards or a set of wooden stump place cards & holders to creatively display the names and table numbers.

Lighting is one of the most crucial decor elements of your wedding reception. Consider hanging pretty string lights above the reception area or arrange a ton of gleaming LED candles to light up your venue and keep the party going even after the sun goes down.

3. Hanging Decorations

Including hanging installations in your wedding design will not only pep up your wedding reception decorations but will also help tie all the decor elements together with your theme.
